snippet: There is nothing in the two candidates’ plans that would have had much chance of stopping Ahmad Khan Rahami from planting bombs in New York and New Jersey....
abstract: Anti-terrorism plans presented by both Hillary Clinton and Donald Trump would have failed to prevent bombings carried out by Ahmad Khan Rahami in New York and New Jersey; case of Rahami, which defies categories and illustrates how personal demons can morph into ideologically driven violence, exposes terrorism debate as overly simplistic.

byline.original: By DAVID E. SANGER and ERIC SCHMITT
byline.contributor: Thomas Kaplan contributed reporting from High Point, N.C., and Jackie Calmes from Washington.

lead_paragraph: There is nothing in the two candidates’ plans that would have had much chance of stopping Ahmad Khan Rahami from planting bombs in New York and New Jersey.

headline.main: Bombing Case Points to Gaps in Trump’s and Clinton’s Antiterrorism Plans
headline.print_headline: Bombing Case Points to Gaps in Rivals’ Plans
